instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 u9410 keeps blowing.
threads.message:
Hey all this one came water damage. lvds was bad and ppvout_sw_lcdbklt pins were gone. SO i ran jumpers and turned on the macbook and boom - instant smoke.
So i go over thunderbolt and check all components around u9410 and make sure everything is good. Re done the u9410 now v2 with jumpers to get connection as it burnt out prety bad and again - boom and it smoked.

Can anyone help?
thanks

threads.title: 820-3115 u9410 keeps blowing.
threads.message: Forget it remove U9410 and live without thunderbolt it is a total waste of time. Does the board have backlight and turn on without U9410?

threads.title: 820-3115 u9410 keeps blowing.
threads.message: its booting without it. I will connect to a good machine see if display working too.

threads.title: 820-3115 u9410 keeps blowing.
threads.message: ok so no display. pin 2,3 no voltage but 4 is measuring 3.33v

threads.title: 820-3115 u9410 keeps blowing.
threads.message: short to ground on pp3v42? how can it still power?

threads.title: 820-3115 u9410 keeps blowing.
threads.message:
Are you sure is short there???
Is impossible, if board starts...
I hope you removed charger and battery when checked that.

"pin 2,3 no voltage but 4 is measuring 3.33v"
Do you talk about J9000?
Check volyage and resistance to ground at pins 6 & 7.

threads.title: 820-3115 u9410 keeps blowing.
threads.message: idk wth is going on but i checked too many bad looking components. this one going to junk pile.
